targets.expr:
(min by(id, name) (
  timestamp(container_last_seen{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"})
  -
  container_last_seen{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}
  or
  time() - max_over_time(container_last_seen{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__range])
))

panels.description: empty when cgroup doesn't have cpu limit
panels.title: cpu throttled rate

panels.description: empty when cgroup doesn't have cpu limit
panels.title: cpu limit

panels.description: sum_over_time of seconds spent throtting. Empty is container doesn't have cpu limit.
panels.title: cpu throttled (total time)

panels.description: empty when cgroup doesn't have cpu limit
panels.title: CPU limit %

panels.description: empty when cgroup doesn't have cpu limit
panels.title: CPU throttling periods %

options.content:
- `rss` is anon memory
- `wss` = rss + active cache + kernel
- `raw` = `rss` + full cache + kernel
- Cache is active if it used _often_ (more than once?)

What to look for:
- WSS reaching limit causes file garbage collection
- RSS reaching limit causes OOM kill

targets.expr:
max(
  max_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  or
  max_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
)
-
max(
  avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  or
  avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
)

# container_memory_usage_bytes = rss + cache + kernel
# but container_memory_kernel_usage is broken in current version of cadvisor, it's always zero
max(
  (
    avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_rss{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  )
  or
  (
    avg_over_time(container_memory_usage_bytes{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_rss{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
  )
)

panels.description: empty when cgroup doesn't have memory limit
panels.title: memory / limit %

targets.expr:
max(
  (
    avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_mapped_file{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval])
  )
  or
  (
    avg_over_time(container_memory_cache{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
    -
    avg_over_time(container_memory_mapped_file{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval])
  )
)
